conclusion: Identify the starting points of the liquid flow, which are A, B, and C.
Observe the direction of the liquid flow from each starting point. A flows to the right, B flows to the left, and C flows to the left.
Determine the path of the liquid flow from each starting point. A flows to the right and then downwards, B flows to the left and then downwards, and C flows to the left and then downwards.
Identify the containers at the end of the liquid flow paths. A flows into container D, B flows into container E, and C flows into container E.
Conclude that the liquid from A will flow into container D, and the liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
